articles.title: Russian Drone Strike Hits Kyiv Government Building, Three Dead
articles.summary: Russia launched its largest-ever air attack on Ukraine's capital, striking a government building for the first time. The devastating assault resulted in three casualties, including a child, and caused significant structural damage.

articles.title: Japanese PM Ishiba Steps Down Amid Growing Party Tensions
articles.summary: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announces resignation following his coalition's loss of Upper House majority. The decision aims to prevent internal division within the ruling Liberal Democratic Party.

articles.title: Major Internet Disruption Hits Asia After Red Sea Cable Damage
articles.summary: Multiple undersea internet cables in the Red Sea have been damaged, causing widespread connectivity issues across Pakistan, Asia, and the Middle East. Technical teams are working to restore services.

articles.title: Google Hit With Record $3.5B EU Fine Over AdTech Violations
articles.summary: European Commission imposes massive fine on Google for antitrust violations in digital advertising. The tech giant is accused of unfairly favoring its own ad services over competitors.
details: Market Share Affected: 80% of EU digital ads

articles.title: New Study Reveals Limited Carbon Storage Capacity for Climate Action
articles.summary: Research indicates that Earth's capacity to store carbon dioxide is significantly lower than previously estimated, raising concerns about the effectiveness of current climate change mitigation strategies.

articles.title: OPEC+ Plans October Output Increase Amid Demand Uncertainty
articles.summary: OPEC+ considers raising oil production quotas from October, though increase may be smaller than recent months due to anticipated seasonal decline in global demand.

articles.title: US Immigration Raid at Korean Plant Strains Diplomatic Relations
articles.summary: US authorities arrested 475 South Korean citizens at Hyundai-LG construction site in Georgia, causing diplomatic tension amid ongoing pressure for South Korean investment in US industry.

articles.title: Apple Set to Unveil Revolutionary iPhone Air at Annual Event
articles.summary: Apple's upcoming event promises major innovations including a thinner iPhone Air model, potential price increases, and new AI features, marking significant changes to their flagship product line.

articles.title: Trump Plans South Korea Visit, Possible Meeting with Chinese Leader
articles.summary: Former President Trump prepares for October visit to South Korea during APEC trade ministers' meeting in Gyeongju, with potential talks with Chinese leadership on the agenda.

articles.title: Former Trump Surgeon General Demands RFK Jr's Dismissal
articles.summary: Dr. Jerome Adams, Trump's former surgeon general, calls for Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr's removal amid growing controversy over his department's management decisions.

dailyGreeting: Good morning! Brace for major tech and global updates.

historicalEvents.description: Boxer Protocol signed, ending Chinese Boxer Rebellion
German Luftwaffe begins London Blitz bombing campaign
US and Panama sign Panama Canal Treaties
